data.title: Make FrozenUnderFog footprint include '_'
data.body: Fixes #11247.

data.title: No mouse pointer
data.body: I downloaded the latest version of Red Alert 2 days ago. I use Windows. First night it worked fine without problems. After that the mouse pointer has disappeared in the menu and in the game itself. Mouse is still working and I can chance settings or play without visible pointer. I already installed game several times again, but the problem continues.

data.title: White screen when running OpenRA with USB-Dockingstation
data.body:
Hi,

at Home i am using an "Plugable UD-3900" USB-Dockingstation to use my Notebook on my Desk.
If i run OpenRA (20160508) on the dedicated Notebook, everything works fine,
If i run OpenRA while the Dockingstation is connected i just get a white Screen.

After I disconnect the dockingstation while i see the white Screen, i can see the running OpenRA at the Notebook.

There is no Error on the Log-Files and OpenRA keeps running normal (no crash!).

data.title: Trait HoldDuration: Doesn't Work.
data.body: this TicksToHold: works

data.title: OpenRA doesn't start, but computer restarts
data.body:
I installed the latest OpenRA build (release-20160508) on my Windows 8.1 64 bit computer.
When I double click the OpenRA icon on my desktop, the screen turns white and 3 seconds later, my computer restarts.

The log files in my user home directory are all empty, except perf.log.
[OpenRA.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/262294/OpenRA.zip)

data.title: Sometimes units will move rather than attack a camo pill under fog
data.body:
You can see this on [this replay](http://www.gamereplays.org/openra/replays.php?game=92&show=details&id=311530) just after 11:15.

This only seems to happen sporadically and apparently happens in other instances too (not just with camo pills)

data.title: Can't queue harvester commands
data.body: Tried with both left and right click orders, commands are issued instantly rather than queued, this bug was present before the release too

data.title: Left click orders don't work for navigating the mini map
Auto-generated Warhead and Effect documentation
data.body: The `[Desc()]` tags in `OpenRA.Mods.Common.Warheads` and `OpenRA.Mods.Common.Effects` aren't yet used to autogenerate documentation like the very useful https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits help.

data.title: Saving a map where the game has no write access causes an ArgumentNullException
data.body:
Two issues I found when starting a new map:
1. In the dialogue box that let's you put the map name, author, file name, etc. the tab button doesn't allow you to switch between fields.
2. If when creating a new map you use a filename that is already in use, instead of bringing up some sort of box asking if you'd like to overwrite the existing map the program just exits, no crash dialogue or anything even.

EDIT: Just reproduced 2, created a crash dialogue this time. Here's the exception.log:

> Red Alert Mod at Version release-20160508
> on map 1b896bb92014607fc1d9c3c1feff5f2a22f902ea (Desert Shellmap by Scott_NZ).
> Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
> Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34209
> Exception of type `System.ArgumentNullException`: Value cannot be null.
> Parameter name: key
>    at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.FindEntry(TKey key)

>    at OpenRA.Primitives.Cache`2.get_Item(T key)
>    at OpenRA.MapCache.get_Item(String key)

data.title: Fedora / Centos / Suse Repos are in 20151224 release
data.body:
Hi, I succesfuly installed openra in my centos 6.7 server, but it was installed the previous release 20151224 instead the 20160508 release.

Please update the repository

Can I manually update overwriting the installed files using the github source?

data.title: Internet crashes soon after starting an online or skirmish match
data.body: I need help, I can't play Openra online because whenever I go online and play the very beginning of a multiplayer match or a skirmish with internet connected. It crashes the connection and I have to restart my computer to regain internet access. This has been happening for months and patches haven't fixed it. I use a wired internet connection, and this has made me only be able to download updates from chrome and play skirmish and missions while disconnected. I really want to play multiplayer again. Your help would be greatly appreciated. I use Windows 10 in case that matters.

data.title: Tick Tank not attacking properly
data.body: Tick tank don't focus enemy units when they are in range and A-move just make him move.

data.title: Buildings get locked by Demolishable activity before their destruction
data.body: Solves #10846 ! Made mostly by @abcdefg30 so love (or hate) him, I only debugged the last part. :tophat:

data.title: Error codepage 850 not supported
data.body:
Basically a follow-up of this:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10197

still not working. 

OS:
Linux Mint 17.1 64 Bit

data.title: openra fails to start: Missing method .ctor in assembly /usr/lib/openra/OpenRA.Game.exe
data.body:
Fresh install on Fedora22 from the openSUSE Build Service repository, openra fails to start.

Full output:

```
$ openra
Missing method .ctor in assembly /usr/lib/openra/OpenRA.Game.exe, type System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ExtensionAttribute
Can't find custom attr constructor image: /usr/lib/openra/OpenRA.Game.exe mtoken: 0x0a000002

Unhandled Exception: System.TypeLoadException: Could not load type 'System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ExtensionAttribute' from assembly 'OpenRA.Game'.
[ERROR] FATAL UNHANDLED EXCEPTION: System.TypeLoadException: Could not load type 'System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ExtensionAttribute' from assembly 'OpenRA.Game'.
```

Package versions:
- openra-20160508-1.1.noarch
- mono-winfx-2.10.8-8.fc21.i686
- mono-core-2.10.8-8.fc21.i686

data.title: Add slow selfealing to the harvester (RA mod)
data.body:
Realization of #11224 due general acceptance, for RA mod atm, if people agree I can push commits for other mods.

While most people argued that heal should be at Mamooth Tank rate, I found that to be stupidly high (harv is attacked by group of infantry, goes back to ref and is healed almost to 50% when it gets back). I set it to quite slow, feeling that while it decreases unnecessary macro, it also motivates player to play safe and reapir it to full health fast (for cash).

data.title: Reduce effectiveness of demo truck against air targets
data.body:
I did the nerf by removing the ValidTarget: Air from some of the warheads. Now it roughly seems that any unit in the scorched-earth area will be instantly killed, others are only damaged
![openra-2016-05-10t184901z](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12610736/15158793/c15b8784-16f1-11e6-93c1-f32647c42a9a.png)

This is VERY open to discussion, which already partly happened in #10799 but got sidetracked. This is response to both #10799 and #10865.

data.title: FileNotFoundException when initializing the game

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Hi,
I just installed the game and fiddled with the settings, saved and restarted.
Then I had an invisible cursor, so I reset the configuration.

Now the game does not start anymore (even after reinstall) and fails with this being the only error:

**exception.log**

```
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.18444
Exception of type `System.IO.FileNotFoundException`: Das System kann die angegebene Datei nicht finden. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80070002)
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeAssembly.nLoadFile(String path, Evidence evidence)
   at System.Reflection.Assembly.LoadFile(String path)
   at OpenRA.Sound..ctor(String engineName)
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

```

Is there a possible workaround for me? (:

data.title: Remove the last relicts of InitialActivity
data.body:
Seems like this was forgotten in #8674. The upgrade rule looks fine though.
Reported by `The_madd` on IRC.

data.title: Reduce RA Artillery range from 14 to 12 cells
data.body: Some consensus was reached on the [forums](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=19556).

data.title: Better automatic player color assignment
data.body:
The automated color assigned to players (mostly a problem with AI players / skirmish) usually needs colors to be adjusted manually as the automatic picks can be pretty indistinguishable:

![automatic_color_asigned](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10639257/15106933/d555f86c-15cc-11e6-9add-11f02ed72ad6.jpg)

My suggestion when picking an automated color is to:
- befiore repeating a hue pick colors from different hues - don't add another green when other hues have not been used yet
- first suggest colors that are brighter and more saturated - they are easier to distinguis from one another (colors located roughly in the upper right side of the color picker)

![automatic_color_asigned_tones](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10639257/15107028/88f3b8a0-15cd-11e6-9ee5-86e7ffea96f5.jpg)

data.title: TD crash: maps which contain farmer's field husks
data.body:
When I start a map which contains a destroyed celery field (v17.husk), it throws an exception and crashes.

It doesn't seem that this issue affects any maps which are included with the game, but it does affect a couple maps I've made. (Including Understanding Power and Media Control).

EDIT: Seems to also apply to all the other field husks: v14 -> v18


data.body:
i can force-crash by hitting several times "Esc" when a replay starts running ... i also noticed that whilst "ingame" in skirmish ... the "pause function" would at some point stop working ... meaning , when i go out of the menu (after hammering several times "Esc" , the game would not continue .... instead , i manually had to hit the "pause-hotkey" in order to continue the game (this issues might be linked together)

---

data.title: Skip TD guard tower make anim frames containing yellow color
data.body:
Skipping the offening frames is easier than fixing the art. Besides, except for the color nothing changes between the last 3 frames anyway.

Closes #11239.

data.title: Added a welding overlay to the Nod repair vehicle
data.body: In Marn's Tiberian Sun mod the Nod repair tank does not only the welding sounds, but also has a nice visual overlay which makes it way easier to understand for the player what is going on.

data.title: Polished the Tiberian Sun laser weaponry
data.body: Marn's mod looks way more polished. He fixed the blocky laser artwork by making them less thick and adding transparency to the sonic beam which looks way more like in the original this way.

data.title: Update the Tiberian Sun AI
data.body: Some units were missing. The build percentages have been tweaked for a more varied army. Taken from Marn's mod.

data.title: Fixed a crash when replay is selected in the wrong mod
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10101.
